content: Unfortunately that did not answer my question. I recall not needing build-std on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu to build for x86_64-unknown-uefi.
fee1-dead has marked this topic as resolved.
You're asking rustup to require that rust-std component is available somehow.
what the host system is does not matter at all to availability of target components.
since uefi is a no_core target, asking rustup to make std component available should not be necessary at all?
Ah right. :shrug: then. Host toolchain should still be irrelevant here afaik. I believe host tools are shipped as a different component of any.
